Certainly, here are some of the unique elements of each story:

1. Pyrrhos and the Flood: In this story, Pyrrhos builds a great tower to protect his family and the animals from a massive flood that destroys the world. The story emphasizes the destructive power of water and the importance of preparation and resilience in the face of disaster.
2. Pyrrhos and the Fire: In this story, Pyrrhos builds a great tower to protect his family and the animals from a raging fire that engulfs the world. The story emphasizes the power of magic and the importance of ingenuity and resourcefulness in the face of disaster.
3. Pyrrhos and the Earthquake: In this story, Pyrrhos builds a great tower to protect his family from a devastating earthquake. The story emphasizes the destructive power of earthquakes and the importance of knowledge and expertise in building structures that can withstand them.

While all three stories share a common theme of resilience and survival in the face of disaster, each one has its own unique elements. The flood story emphasizes the power of water, the fire story emphasizes the power of magic, and the earthquake story emphasizes the importance of engineering and knowledge. Each story provides a different perspective on how humans can overcome great challenges through preparation, ingenuity, and expertise.
